abstract_summ: Data suggest ddPCR is allows for precise quantification of viral load in clinical samples infected with SARS-CoV-2.In 68 respiratory specimens from a cohort of 35 COVID-19 patients, 32 of them with mild disease, we found SARS coronavirus-2 virus culture and sub-genomic RNA was rarely detectable beyond 8 days after onset of illness although virus RNA by RT-PCR remained detectable for many weeks.Here we explain what happens when we are infected by respiratory viruses, including SARS-CoV-2, which causes COVID-19.• Prolonged virus shedding could be found among COVID-19 patients after clinical symptoms resolved and specific antibody emerged.We examined HARVI incidence and clinical respiratory virus testing practices in a cohort of hospitalized patients with acute respiratory illness.They described the development of clinical symptoms of pneumoniae in patients and discussed about the importance of other respiratory viruses that cause symptoms similar to COVID-19.• We identified continuous viral shedding in the urine of a severe COVID-19 patient.
